content: bright sparks hat is cast on and a short rib hem is worked before moving into the faux cable and rib pattern a short rib pattern section is followed by decreases at the top of the hat a pom-pom can be added and your little bright sparks hat is ready this is the perfect quick project a lovely gift knit or for using up bigger amounts of leftovers with the rib texture it fits lots of different heads from children to adults you can even eliminate the pattern and work just the k3 p2 rib up the hat for a simpler version *finished measurements* diameter of finished hat- 18 22 25 / 46 56 64 cm height of finished hat- 7 7 ¾ 8 ¾ / 18 20 22 5 cm *needles and notions* us 6 / 4 mm circular needles for hat knitting adjust needle size as needed to obtain correct gauge us 4 / 3 5 mm circular needles for hat knitting tapestry needle pom-pom optional *yarn* sample knit with ashford tekapo dk wool 100% new zealand wool 200m / 218 yds per 100gm for yarn substitution it is recommended to use a non-treated dk weight 100% wool yarn approximately 130 175 218 yds / 120 160 200 m of yarn is required
